p: The chemical constituents of EO of E. bonariensis collected from Alexandria, Egypt has been reported in addition to its antimicrobial and insecticidal activities [ 34]. In this study, 25 compounds were identified from EO of E. bonariensis including sesqui- and monoterpenes. From the total of this oil, α-bergamotene, and D-limonene represented the mains with concentrations of 27.4 and 22.5%. In the same report, EO of C. linifolia was documented to exhibit antibacterial potentiality against B. subtilis with MIC of 125 mg/mL [ 34, 35]. Little reports concerning the chemical profiles as well as biological activities of Erigeron bonariensis L. (syn. Conyza linifolia (Willd.) Täckh.) have been recorded.
